page.title: 10EMPLOYMENT - IDEN GREEN
page.content:
{ROAD HAULIER}- TOM TURK: In 1900 Mr. Turks grandfather was the local carrier with his{horse and cart.} After{1914-18 War}his father started a taxi hire service with a{coal}merchant business and local general haulier. In 1951 Mr. Turk took over the business rapidly expanded. He now has 35 lorries operating in the United Kingdom and employs 50 men. The labour is local though only one lives in Benenden.
65% of the business is for British Gypsum at Robertsbridge,Sussex,120 loads per week, a tonnage of 2,500.
The business has changed from mainly agricultural to building materials and timber. Two Ferrymaster lorries take containers to and from the Ports.
